segments.text: Hi everybody, Dennis Prager here and a happy New Year to you.
I'm actually not even wishing people happy New Year.
I am now at the point of writing back in texts and emails.
I wish you a better New Year.
That will suffice at this time.
I'm not quite there yet where I could wish people a happy New Year
because for so many people it's so difficult at a time.
Anyway, on behalf of Otto, how is Otto doing?
Is he looking great?
By the way, Snoopy is in the room too, but you can't see him.
It's very rare that his brother, the Basset Hound, is in the room at the same time.
By the way, you should see how much they love each other.
It's actually very touching.
How often they will lick the other's face, eyes, ears.
It's part grooming and it's part affection.
But it is very touching.
My wife and I do...
...rew the thought of one of them dying and the effect it'll have on the other.
But you know, that's the way of life.
Death is part of life.
You know, I have a chapter on that in my book on happiness.
I was always aware even when I was very young when you sort of think you're immortal,
but I was very aware everybody dies.
Even saying that is jolting to people
because we have created a society where people don't come into contact with death, especially human death.
Anyway, I do wish you nevertheless a happy new year.
And I was thinking about, as I always do, what would I open up with?
I just want to remind you that these fire side chats are completely spontaneous.
And that has risks in it because, you know, what do I say?
Well, I regret having said something that unscripted, but it doesn't matter that the genuineness is more important than any risks that are taken.
So I was thinking of any number of things to open up with and then take your questions.
And I have to say something has really grabbed my attention.
I have to read it to you because of the list.
It's a list.
And I didn't memorize the list.
So the speaker of the House of Representatives, many of you are outside of the United States.
So she is sort of the head of one of the two, the word that is usually used in the world, houses of parliament.
We call it Congress in the United States. You call it parliament in most countries.
So we have a Senate and we have a House of Representatives.
The head of the House of Representatives is the speaker of the House.
That is the one who is elected by the dominant party, which in this case is the Democratic Party in the House.
Nancy Pelosi has announced for those of you listening around the world
this will give you as good an idea of what is going on in America as anything I could tell you
and why I believe that everything that left, not liberals, but the left touches is ruined.
Here's a perfect example. And of the absurdity, this is as absurd as it is destructive.
There is now a proposal before the House of Representatives in the United States of America
that no gender specific pronoun, or excuse me, noun can be used.
Here's the list. This can no longer be used in the House of Representatives of the United States if this passes.
This is clause 8C3 of rule 23 of the House's code of official conduct.
Ready? Here are some of the terms not to be used any longer.
Father, mother, son, daughter, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, first cousin, nephew.
I don't know why first cousin because that's not gender specific.
Maybe because of the word first that implies that a second cousin is inferior. I don't know.

Nephew, niece, husband, wife, father-in-law, mother-in-law, son-in-law, daughter-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law, sister-in-law, step-father, step-mother, step-son, step-daughter, step-brother, step-brother, step-sister, half-brother, half-sister, grand-son, and grand-daughter.
So what will take their place? You ask.
So, for example, parent, you don't say, I am not a father. So if I were in the House, I could not say, if the Democrats have their way, I cannot say, oh, I am a father of two.
So in my case, I am a father of two sons. I would have to say, I am a parent of two children.
Get it?
So, yes, child, oh, yes. So, do you have any brothers or sisters? No. I have one sibling.
And so on and so forth. I love the one where you can't say, brother-in-law or sister-in-law, you can say, sibling-in-law.
I am going to refer to my sister-in-law from that one as my sibling-in-law. She will know what I am talking about for good reason.
Now, here is the danger.
Liberals, now specifically liberals, liberals will dismiss this as trivial. That's the point.
Liberals don't agree with this. This is a left-wing position, but liberals don't care.
So they let the left get away with everything it wants.
Liberals don't understand that conservatives are their allies, not the left.
This is the greatest single mistake in contemporary life.
Liberals who often have wonderful values don't understand that it's us conservatives or it's we conservatives who protect their values, like free speech, racial integration, etc.
Liberals don't think it's wrong to say, I'm a father. Left this thing gets wrong to say, I am a father.
But what do liberals do? They say, no big deal.
Antifa destroys cities? Okay. They got carried away. They're a minority.
There's always an excuse for the left on the part of the liberal. Always. I mean, always. I have no exception.
There is really nothing the left could do that would render a liberal less likely or certainly decided not to vote Democrat. It would not happen.
So deep is the brainwash that the right is their enemy, not the left. That's what it means.
So let me tell you what price is paid. So I'll dedicate this to the liberal viewer.

And for all of you for that matter, is this a big deal? Am I making a mountain out of a molehill that you can no longer say father, mother, brother, sister, son, daughter in the US House of Representatives if this passes?
Well, this is a tragedy.
The human species is composed of men and women. This is not anti-transgender.
You consider yourself, you're biologically male and think you're a woman. You look like a woman, dress like a woman, talk like a woman, have a woman's name. I will refer to you as a woman.
I don't have an issue with that. It's none of my business what your private parts are or what your chromosomes are. I understand that.
That has nothing to do with this. The transgender man, of course says man or father or son. That's the irony. They most affirm a gender identity.
This is for the non-binary. Do you know any non-binary people? Do you? Anyone who identifies as neither? They exist, but they are spectacularly rare, far rarer than transgender who are very rare.

So this has nothing to do with non-binary people in the US Congress, of whom there are zero. This has to do with being woke. This has to do with the chaos that the left wishes consciously or unconsciously to create in society.
Tear down everything. That's what it amounts to. And you know who I feel the worst for? Young people.
To think that you would grow up in a world where there are no men and women, only people. There are no mothers and fathers, only parents. No sons and daughters, only children.

What a poorer world. It was one of the most exciting things to me growing up that I'm a boy. What are these girls about? What is girl? It was like, whoa, what's a girl? And a girl thinking, oh boys. What are boys about? What is that like? It was exciting. It was frightening. It was for many nerve-wracking, but it was so much part.
It's so part of life. Something so rich in life as men and women, male and female, mothers and fathers, sons and daughters, is now being stripped away.
And I just, I do. I feel for young people. I feel for young people on so many grounds. You're not, you're not really American. You're not really a Christian. You're not really a Jew.
You're a black or a white. Think like that matters. You realize all important distinctions have been destroyed and the trivial distinction has been made important.
It's important to be a member of your nation. It's important to be a member of a religion. It's unbelievably unimportant what color you are.
It's the least important thing about you.
And finally, another terrible thing about what it is to be young today is the left is destroying your past and destroying your future.
Your past if you're American or any group, but especially American, your past if you're American is awful and your future is even awfuler.
Because climate change is an existential threat to your life, which is not true.
I've been hearing that it's an existential threat now for 30 years. Every 30 years, every 12 years, in 12 years it'll be too late.
Then 12 years passes. Very little actually happens. 12 years, it'll be too late.
So if you're a young person, you have no past to identify with and your future is utterly bleak.
All courtesy of the woke, the left. Okanoke.
Let's go to your questions. And here we go with number one.
Yes, my friend. This is one of the most depressing things in my life as an American.
That's my column. I hope you will all read it. I hope you read my column every week.
It's up at my website. It's up at Town Hall. It's up at Daily Wire. It's up at American Greatness.
Jewish World Review.
So anywhere, I don't care where you read it as long as you do. And it is exactly about this subject.
How sad it has been to me, the acceptance by so many Americans of the curtailing of their liberties.
All of course in the name of safety.
It's an interesting false God, the safety God. It's an interesting one.
In the ancient world, every culture had child sacrifice or virgin sacrifice, human sacrifice.
We think that we are way advanced, but we're not.
In the name of safety, the God of safety, the number of lives sacrificed, the number of livelihoods certainly sacrificed is staggering.
Oh, it's not safe to open your restaurant. If it's not safe to open a restaurant, don't go.
Nobody's forcing anybody to go to a restaurant. Don't go. If you believe you'll die or might die, if you go to a restaurant, don't go.
But to deprive people of a livelihood.
And again, you say, well, they don't die. They bring home the virus from the restaurant which will kill Grandpa.
So sit with Grandpa outside. That's it. Or by the way, if masks are so effective, just talk to Grandpa with a mask on.
But hey, I am a Grandpa. And let me tell you something. I don't want everybody younger than me to have no life because of the God of safety.
You deserve a life. I'm prepared to take the risk of dropping dead from COVID so that you actually have a life.
Okay. And I speak on behalf of the great majority of people my age. Believe it or not.
More young people are scared out of their minds than old people. That's the irony.
Because you have only experienced being scared by the media.
It is astonishing that people have accepted no liberty in their lives during this period.
That government would take away so many of their rights. But I live in California where there are virtually no rights.
I went to visit my son in Florida and I went to give some speeches for PragerU. I went to Turning Point USA.
By the way, you should watch my talk at Turning Point USA a couple of weeks ago. It's on the Internet.
And it was to thousands of young people. I really would like you to watch that speech and then pass it along please.
It's really important in my opinion to hear. So now Snoopy is visiting Otto.
You see what I mean? Oh, this is a rare. This is a great moment in fireside chat history.
You're seeing the brothers loving each other up.
This doesn't end by the way. Generally speaking, once one of them starts grooming the other, the other will actually move away because their hair is starting to be removed by the other's tongue.
Well done Snoopy. Very nice. He's made his debut. It's not his debut. Right? He's been on before. Yeah, almost semi debut.
Everything good, Otto?
The response to my saying, Otto is very moving to me.
I could have said checkerboard and come to say the same response.
You have to understand, Otto, I relate to Otto. Otto has an ability to stay calm and cool through everything.
And I sort of have that. That's my nature too. It's a blessing to have that nature by the way.
You know what I should talk about? I think I did the right nature. The natures were given.
What was that number what? I don't remember what number, but it's a very important thing to know what your nature is.
And then battle at the rest of your life. That's pretty much the way it works.
All right. Yes. The ability. Oh, and it's just so much terrible going on. Not only the loss of freedom.
I mean, the snitching. Was it Eric Garcetti, the mayor of Los Angeles, actually said people should snitch on their neighbors.
And there's a viral video of it happening in Quebec.
Six people gathered for New Year's. Six people in an apartment. Somebody snitched. They were arrested.
Amazing. Antifa could commit all this violence. Nobody gets arrested.
But if you have a New Year's Eve party in your own apartment with six people, then people get arrested.
It's a very dark time in that way.
All right, Grayson. Thank you. Gwendolyn, 23 years old, Kelso, Missouri. High Dennis, Otto and Megan. All right, Megan.
She's still not ahead of Otto, but she's up there. You got to admit. And it's more than your arm.
No, no, no, it's now all of Megan.
I watched your speech for Turning Point. Oh, perfect for Turning Point's Student Action Summit. And I absolutely loved it. Please see it.
I also loved your camera. Now you're talking. It's very touching that you noticed.
Yeah, I brought the camera onto the stage to take a picture of the audience. Why not? Right?
I mean, I want memories too.
You, Sebastian Gorta, Kimberly, Guilfoyle, Don, Jr., etc.
were also passionate about what you stand for. It is hard to find anyone who's passionate about anything anymore.
And that's very sad. I have a comment on that. How can people become passionate about anything again when they've never felt it?
God bless you all. So, you know, I could do a whole opening thing on passion.
So you're going to find this, Megan, you're going to love the story. So listen to this.
This is an insight into how I have tried to make my life happy.
So when I was dating in my 20s, does everybody know what dating is?
Okay, because it's not used as much now, I know.
Anyway, so I would date, I went on dates when I was 20s. Some dates were boring. Everybody has that. Some dates were boring.
So what did I do about that?
I made a very interesting decision.
I decided that the next time I'm with a boring date, I am going to try to figure out why do I find this person boring.
So I made boring dates fascinating for me because I was like an anthropologist with a tribe of boring people.
Why are they boring? And it was very interesting. I came to a number of conclusions, but the biggest was she had no passion.
Nothing really mattered that much to her.
Yes, she liked movies or she would talk about her favorite movie or favorite food, but that's not the same thing.
And I'm passionate about a lot, as you probably know, and that really struck me.
And do you know what? I don't have a great answer for you.
If you have a nature that is not passionate about anything, how do you gain one?
So here is my fear.
I think that most religious people have a built-in passion.
They're passionate about their religion. The Bible, their religion, their church, their synagogue,
their church or synagogue study group, they have a lot that gives them passion.
Their faith does.
That's pretty universal among truly religious people.
Secular people don't have that, but they want to be passionate about something.
So that explains a tremendous amount of what we're seeing now.
Anti-racism, quote unquote, has become the passion.
So anti-racism is the passion.
And it fills their somewhat empty soul, which has been emptied because of secularism.
Secularism is great for government and terrible for everything else, as I've said all of my life.
And they've filled the lack of passion with this passion.
And you see it, they're just screaming. They're screaming.
I mean, the very fact that this is meaningful, we won't say daughter or son or father or mother.
It's like artificial passion. Leftism is artificial passion.
It's an interesting new term that I would use for it.
So yes, it's a very significant issue you touched upon.
Lorry 58, Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.
Not only have I been to Winnipeg on a number of occasions, giving their lecture, but I even remember that the windiest city in the windiest street corner in Canada is portage.
And Maine in Winnipeg.
Bet you that moved you, Lorry.
Hi, my husband and I started watching your fireside chats when the lockdown hit Canada last March.
Oh, thank God for the lockdown.
We enjoy watching you in auto every week. You hear that? Oh?
Is he moved?
Deeply.
In his usual way.
Yeah, he's moved.
Our conservative premier, that is the premier in candidates by province.
So America states with governors in Canada, it's provinces with premieres.
Our conservative premier, Brian Pallister, has the province of Manitoba and what appears to be the toughest lockdown in Canada.
I did not know that.
I was more than Quebec.
Whoa.
He declared certain items non-essential there for my elderly father could not walk into a store to buy a toaster.
But we had to buy an online and wait a week for curbside pickup.
People are dying buying toasters.
Toasters.
I totally get it.
Yesterday my husband tried to go to Lowe's to buy a new window blind.
However, that aisle was all taped off.
As our premier decided this too was a non-essential item.
This is crazy what we're living through.
What do you think is driving great question?
What do you think is driving politicians to not just crash our economies but burden us with loony restrictions?
Stores have actually been fined for selling non-essential items.
Thanks.
Okay.
I've been asking myself this too because this is not only it's in America.
There's a big division between Republican governors and Democratic governors.
But around the world like in Manitoba, conservatives or the UK with Boris Johnson, who originally did not want to lock down and then fell apart.
And now it's got a huge lockdown.
Israel, India, these are right wing governments and terrible unbelievably catastrophic lockdowns.
So here's my theory.
Number one, I don't know if there are two theories I have.
I don't know which order.
I don't know which is more important than the other.
But here they are in no order.
Nobody wants to take the risk of being a leader as a result of whose policies a lot of his fellow citizens died.
There is a lack of courage that is an animating issue left or right.
That's they don't want the dead on their beat, as it were, on their watch.
Number two, they are all well educated, these leaders, and they have imbibed the religion of experts.
Experts say, and then they genuflect.
Experts say, what does that mean?
Why do experts have wisdom?
Experts have expertise.
Expertise doesn't tell you what to do.
Expertise tells you information.
That's all that has.
The record of wisdom from the expert community is very low, very, very low.
That's why many years ago the great American conservative thinker, William F. Buckley, said something to the effect,
I'd rather be governed by the first thousand names in the Boston phone book than by a thousand Harvard professors.
Why did that resonate with people?
Because they don't associate Harvard professors with wisdom, only with expertise.
Yes, if I want to know how cells work, I will go to a biologist.
If I want to know whether to have a lockdown, I have no interest in going to a biologist.
I will hear his information, but why do I assume he's wise?
And what about all the epidemiologists?
Many, many, and other scientists who have been totally opposed to lockdowns, they get no hearing.
Is that, I mean, is that stupid?
Well, there you go. Today you have not only seen Snoopy, you have heard Snoopy in the background.
I think that's a big part of what is animating. Those two things, they're afraid to have people die on their watch.
And the religion of experts say it's the number of crushed lives because of this economic,
lockdown. It breaks my heart. The number of people who have lost their livelihoods.
The number of people who have gone on drugs. The number of spouses or children abused because people are home too much.
Every indicator of pathology in society has increased because of the lockdown.
And I'm not even sure it saved any lives. That's the ultimate irony.
You know, I would save lives a lot more lives. Early intervention when people are symptomatic.
That's what would have done it. That would have been infinitely more productive than ruining untold people's lives with lockdowns.
I assume we're at our time.
Yes, indeed. It's a wrap. Thank you for being with me. I will be with you next week on behalf of Otto Bewell.

text: Hi everybody, Dennis Prager here and a happy New Year to you. I'm actually not even wishing people happy New Year. I am now at the point of writing back in texts and emails. I wish you a better New Year. That will suffice at this time. I'm not quite there yet where I could wish people a happy New Year because for so many people it's so difficult at a time. Anyway, on behalf of Otto, how is Otto doing? Is he looking great? By the way, Snoopy is in the room too, but you can't see him. It's very rare that his brother, the Basset Hound, is in the room at the same time. By the way, you should see how much they love each other. It's actually very touching. How often they will lick the other's face, eyes, ears. It's part grooming and it's part affection. But it is very touching. My wife and I do... ...rew the thought of one of them dying and the effect it'll have on the other. But you know, that's the way of life. Death is part of life. You know, I have a chapter on that in my book on happiness. I was always aware even when I was very young when you sort of think you're immortal, but I was very aware everybody dies. Even saying that is jolting to people because we have created a society where people don't come into contact with death, especially human death. Anyway, I do wish you nevertheless a happy new year. So we have a Senate and we have a House of Representatives. The head of the House of Representatives is the speaker of the House. That is the one who is elected by the dominant party, which in this case is the Democratic Party in the House. Here's a perfect example. And of the absurdity, this is as absurd as it is destructive. There is now a proposal before the House of Representatives in the United States of America that no gender specific pronoun, or excuse me, noun can be used. Here's the list. This can no longer be used in the House of Representatives of the United States if this passes. This is clause 8C3 of rule 23 of the House's code of official conduct. Ready? Here are some of the terms not to be used any longer. Father, mother, son, daughter, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, first cousin, nephew. I don't know why first cousin because that's not gender specific. Maybe because of the word first that implies that a second cousin is inferior. I don't know. So if I were in the House, I could not say, if the Democrats have their way, I cannot say, oh, I am a father of two. So in my case, I am a father of two sons. I would have to say, I am a parent of two children. Get it? So, yes, child, oh, yes. So, do you have any brothers or sisters? No. I have one sibling. And so on and so forth. I love the one where you can't say, brother-in-law or sister-in-law, you can say, sibling-in-law. I am going to refer to my sister-in-law from that one as my sibling-in-law. Because climate change is an existential threat to your life, which is not true. I've been hearing that it's an existential threat now for 30 years. If it's not safe to open a restaurant, don't go. Nobody's forcing anybody to go to a restaurant. Don't go. If you believe you'll die or might die, if you go to a restaurant, don't go. But to deprive people of a livelihood. And again, you say, well, they don't die. They bring home the virus from the restaurant which will kill Grandpa. So sit with Grandpa outside. That's it. Or by the way, if masks are so effective, just talk to Grandpa with a mask on. But hey, I am a Grandpa. And let me tell you something.
